                 'technologies de base qui constituent les produits '
                 'd’Autodesk. La personne idéale sera un(e) technicien(ne) '
                 'pratique ayant l’expérience appropriée en technologie et en '
                 'code.\xa0  \n'
                 '\u202f\xa0\n'
                 '\n'
                 '**Responsabilités**\n'
                 '\n'
                 '* Implémenter des prototypes et des composants de logiciel\n'
                 '* Collaborer avec l’équipe d’excellent(e)s ingénieur(e)s '
                 'pour concevoir, planifier, développer, tester, livrer et '
                 'entretenir des fonctionnalités complexes et de nouveaux '
                 'sous-systèmes\n'
                 '* Participer aux évaluations du code en donnant des conseils '
                 'à ce sujet\n'
                 '\n'
                 '**Exigences minimales**\n'
                 '\n'
                 '* Expérience en conception d’applications distribuées à '
                 'grande échelle\n'
                 '* Souci du détail et passion pour le développement de beaux '
                 'logiciels\n'
                 '* Désir constant de s’améliorer, d’apprendre et d’aller plus '
                 'loin\n'
                 '* Études en cours pour l’obtention d’un baccalauréat ou '
                 'd’une maîtrise en informatique ou dans un domaine technique '
                 'connexe\n'

                 'qualité avec une vaste expérience en test unitaire et en '
                 'développement basé sur les tests\n'
                 '* Excellentes compétences en communication et en rédaction\n'
                 '* Capacité à travailler efficacement et en toute autonomie '
                 'dans un environnement dynamique et fluide\n'

                 'is seeking an Account Manager for our inside sales '
                 'organization with a consistent record in selling complex '
                 'technology solutions to our customers. This full-time '
                 'position requires close working relationships with NVIDIA '
                 'solution architects and business development leaders to '
                 'drive revenue for the company. If you have a passion for how '
                 'technology is driving multifaceted changes in exciting '
                 'segments like Artificial Intelligence, Deep Learning, Cloud '
                 "and Sophisticated Software Development, we'd like to talk "
                 'with you.\n'
                 '\n'
                 "**What you'll be doing:**\n"
                 '\n'
                 '* Attain a minimum of 100% Quota attainment selling to '
                 'Enterprise Accounts\n'
                 '* Maintain and submit accurate forecasts\n'
                 '* Qualify new opportunities, present NVIDIA solutions, '
                 'overcome objections, negotiate and close business over the '
                 'phone & TEAMS\n'
                 '* Team with NVIDIA Channel, Field Sales & Marketing to build '
                 'your business and facilitate sales opportunities\n'
                 '* Build direct relationships with customers and work closely '
                 'with channel partners to grow sales within your territory\n'
                 '* Lead all aspects of the selling cycle to help customers '
                 'expand revenue\n'
                 '* Develop excellent strategic relationships with customers '
                 'to understand their software and computing needs\n'
                 '* Have an understanding and clear delivery of NVIDIA value '
                 'proposition, key features, product messages, and '
                 'positioning\n'
                 '\n'
                 '**What we need to see:**\n'
                 '\n'
                 '* 5+ years of inside sales experience\n'
                 '* 5+ years of technology quota carrying sales experience '
                 'responsible for the full sales cycle (prospecting, customer '
                 'presentation/demos, negotiating, and closing the sale)\n'
                 '* Fluency in English, Swedish and /or Dutch\n'
                 '* Proven success in rolling up a forecast to sales '
                 'leadership\n'
                 '* Experience with going to market and teaming with '
                 'Technology Industry Channel Partners\n'
                 '* Excellent communication (interpersonal and presentation) '
                 'and closing skills, and have successfully applied these in '
                 'an inside sales environment\n'
                 '* Exceptional customer and channel partner relationship '
                 'skills\n'
                 '* Skilled at selling in a Cloud environment including '
                 'working with CSP, ISV, and end-user customer\n'
                 '* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience\n'
                 '* Salesforce.com experience is required\n'
                 '* Light travel requirements (approximately 5%)\n'
                 '\n'
                 '**Ways to stand out from the crowd:**\n'
                 '\n'
                 '* Adept at balancing intense short-term pressures with '
                 'overall long-term goals\n'
                 '* Excellent listening skills and ability to persuade -- '
                 'using communication that convey concepts in a creative way\n'
                 '* A love for technology and how it can impact businesses\n'
                 '* Passionate for sales and building positive relationships '
                 'with customers and channel partners\n'
                 '* Understanding of data science workflows, modern machine '
                 'learning and AI trends.\n'
                 '* Any additional European languages would be a benefit.\n'
                 '\n'
                 'NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology '
                 'world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most '
                 'intelligent and hardworking people in the world working for '
                 "us. If you're creative and autonomous, we want to hear from "
                 'you!\n'
                 '\n'
                 'You will also be eligible for equity and\xa0benefits. \n'
                 '\n'
                 'NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment '
                 'and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly '
                 'value diversity in our current and future employees, we do '
                 'not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion '
                 'practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national '
                 'origin, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, '
                 'marital status, veteran status, disability status or any '
                 'other characteristic protected by law.\n'

                 'for our NVIDIA Sales Centre, with Polish, English and '

                 'crafting a pipeline of opportunities for NVIDIA’s sales '
                 'teams by implementing lead management and demand generation '

                 'of the NVIDIA platform! You own business development '
                 'execution across a designated region, in close collaboration '
                 'with our Marketing and Sales Teams. This includes the '

                 'a new opportunity for our sales teams to close, but '
                 'pro-active outreach to targeted customers and buyer '
                 'persona’s is equally important.\n'
                 '\n'

                 '\n'

                 'teams by identifying new prospects, qualifying the lead, and '
                 'converting the lead to opportunity status\n'
                 '* Implement demand generation programs for install base and '
                 'new business opportunities\n'
                 '* Maintain a high-volume of daily activity with prospects by '
                 'phone, email, and LinkedIn messaging.\n'
                 '* Seek net new opportunities by calling leads from marketing '
                 'activities including campaigns, events, webinars, referrals, '
                 'and website inquiries.\n'
                 '* Navigate social media and professional network websites '
                 'for prospecting, as well as use Salesforce.com to manage all '
                 'lead activity and opportunity creation\n'
                 '* Collaboration directly with the NVIDIA Marketing team, as '
                 'well as Field, Inside, and Channel Sales\n'
                 '* Have an understanding and clear delivery of NVIDIA value '
                 'proposition, key features, product messages, and '
                 'positioning.\n'
                 '* Attain a minimum of 100% of quota attainment.\n'
                 '\n'

                 '\n'

                 '* Fluency in English, Polish and ideally another Slavic '
                 'European Language.\n'
                 '* 2+ years of sales development (SDR, DSR, SDS etc.) or '
                 'relevant experience preferred.\n'
                 '* Comfortable with performing a high volume of outbound '
                 'calls to prospects.\n'

  'description': 'Job Description\n'
                 '---------------\n'
                 '\n'
                 'Planning a challenging career after graduation? We invite '

                 'silicon validation engineers.  \n'
                 'We are working closely with HW and SW engineers providing '
                 'daily tech support, system integration and platform '
                 'debug.Qualifications\n'
                 '--------------\n'
                 '\n'
                 '* Registered student for a BSc in SW engineering, Electrical '
                 'Engineering or   \n'
                 'Electronics fields.\n'
                 '* Logical problem solving capabilities.\n'
                 '* Willingness to work 3.5-4 days a week\n'
                 '* Proficiency in English communication skills reading '
                 'writing and speaking\n'
                 '* Leading capabilities experience advantage\n'
                 '* Relevant experience advantage\n'
                 '* PE degree in SW \\ Electronics\n'
                 '\n'
                 'Inside this Business Group\n'
                 '--------------------------\n'
                 '\n'
                 'The Infrastructure and Platform Solutions Group (IPSG) '
                 "builds the silicon and platform infrastructure for Intel's "
                 'silicon design teams. IPSG is comprised of a reusable pool '

                 'we experience a shortage of US Workers. These skills '
                 'shortage roles are typically STEM contributing positions '
                 "requiring a master's or PhD degree, or a bachelor’s degree "
                 'with three years’ related job experience. This position does '
                 'not qualify for Intel Sponsorship because it is either (1) a '
                 'non-STEM contributing position, or (2) a STEM position that '
                 'only requires a bachelor’s degree and less than three years’ '
                 'experience.\n'

  'company': 'Intel',
  'description': 'Job Description\n'
                 '---------------\n'
                 '\n'
                 '**Position 1: Process and Equipment Engineer Intern**\n'
                 '\n'
                 'The Process and Equipment Engineer intern will contribute to '
                 'below:  \n'
                 '•\xa0\xa0 \xa0Leading critical resolution of operational '
                 'needs for the Assembly/ Test process and equipment.  \n'
                 '•\xa0\xa0 \xa0Implementing the process control systems and '
                 'monitoring the process to detect signals and maintain it '
                 'within control, so no safety or quality incident occur and '
                 'performance targets are met. Monitor equipment and process '
                 'indicators to reduce process variability.  \n'
                 '•\xa0\xa0 \xa0Defining maintenance procedures, training '
                 'manufacturing technicians and partnering with Manufacturing '
                 'to maintain the equipment with the highest standards. Will '
                 'use High Precision Maintenance methods to execute and '
                 'improve preventive maintenance of the equipment. Provide '
                 'basic and advance troubleshooting to manufacturing equipment '
                 'including corrective and preventive maintenance.  \n'
                 '•\xa0\xa0 \xa0Coordinating, implementing and developing '
                 'equipment and process improvements in regards to safety, '
                 'quality and efficiency. Will use lean rules, principle and '
                 'methods to determine improvement opportunities and develop '
                 'solutions. Will resolve process problems by applying '
                 'structured problem methodologies (Model Based Problem '
                 'Solving, Lean and Statistics).\n'
                 '\n'
                 '**Position 2: Engineering Intern (Cost)**\n'
                 '\n'
                 '•\xa0\xa0 \xa0Collaborate to Department Cost Representative '
                 'to deliver Factory cost budget through projects and '
                 'programs. \xa0  \n'
                 '•\xa0\xa0 \xa0Review, improve, and optimize processing in '
                 'term of Cost idea/ equipment project that contributes to '
                 'factory efficiency.  \n'
                 '•\xa0\xa0 \xa0Learn and apply LEAN/ Project management to do '
                 'optimization across projects.  \n'
                 '•\xa0\xa0 \xa0Join some Working Group to assist projects '
                 'that related to equipment or process.  \n'
                 '•\xa0\xa0 \xa0Drive TEGT/Factory Cost process '
                 'compliance.\xa0\n'
                 '\n'
                 '**Position 3: Engineering Intern (Automation)**\n'
                 '\n'
                 '•\xa0\xa0 \xa0Develop automated systems, dashboard and '
                 'processes to monitor and optimize manufacturing '
                 'operations  \n'
                 '•\xa0\xa0 \xa0Develop and implement robotic automation '
                 'solutions to prevent quality issues. Maintain, debug errors '
                 'and continue to improve those implementations \xa0  \n'
                 '•\xa0\xa0 \xa0Attending training sessions to learn the best '
                 'practices from VN/ VF in automation engineering  \n'
                 '•\xa0\xa0 \xa0Monitor and analyze system performance data to '
                 'identify areas for improvement  \n'
                 '•\xa0\xa0 \xa0Empowered to conduct critical data science '
                 'training for TEGT operation needs.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '**Position 4: Engineering Intern (Quality)**\n'
                 '\n'
                 '•\xa0\xa0 \xa0Direct observe current process across modules, '
                 'analyze and find the best practice to support for '
                 'compliance.\xa0  \n'
                 '•\xa0\xa0 \xa0Standardize process for tracking steps  \n'
                 '•\xa0\xa0 \xa0Build system to record the evidence, monitor '
                 'and trigger if non-compliance  \n'
                 '•\xa0\xa0 \xa0Scan thru’ process and optimize process to '
                 'drive for quality  \n'
                 '•\xa0\xa0 \xa0Perform experiment, analyze issue, and propose '
                 'solution\n'
                 '\n'
                 '**Position 5: Engineering Intern (Headcount)**\n'
                 '\n'
                 '•\xa0\xa0 \xa0Own Direct Observation to do model efficiency '
                 'in department.  \n'
                 '•\xa0\xa0 \xa0Collaborate 4 shift managers/ supervisors so '
                 'that we execute headcount strategy, ensure department '
                 'headcount strategy is connected and executed flawlessly.  \n'
                 '•\xa0\xa0 \xa0Read factory planning and turn it to action '
                 'plan of headcount planning in our department.\xa0  \n'
                 '•\xa0\xa0 \xa0Own Over-Time monitoring and coordinate to '
                 'shift reps to meet ONE GOAL.  \n'
                 '•\xa0\xa0 \xa0Assist headcount project owners to complete it '
                 'per task alignment.\xa0  \n'
                 '•\xa0\xa0 \xa0Hiring coordination for department.  \n'
                 '•\xa0\xa0 \xa0Work with suppliers to monitor so that '
                 'supplier deliver KPIs in term of operation performance such '
                 'as Attrition monitoring/ operation output, etc.\xa0\n'
                 '\n'
                 '**Position 6: Headcount Planning Intern (Manufacturing '
                 'team)**\n'
                 '\n'
                 'Support to measure time run from tool/ process from '
                 'manufacturing teams, manage human resource allocation for '
                 'each module/ tool or production line, support with the '
                 'planning on headcount and training arrangement of new hires '
                 'for production. Other related tasks\n'
                 '\n'
                 '**Position 7: Manufacturing Integrator Intern (Manufacturing '
                 'team)**\n'
                 '\n'
                 '•\xa0\xa0 \xa0Responsible for factory loading plan and '
                 'priority to meet weekly/monthly and quarterly delivery goal '
                 'with the best Cycle Time  \n'
                 '•\xa0\xa0 \xa0Improve Manufacturing Delivery system  \n'
                 'Participate in or lead working groups or task forces that '
                 'support the internal factory loading plan to respond to any '
                 'activities that impact the capacity.  \n'

                 'delivery.  \n'

                 'output.  \n'

                 'LEAN ecosystem to provide business service & quality '
                 'practice to customer.\n'

                 'Culture // (communicating/reporting).\n'

  'company': 'Intel',
  'description': 'Job Description\n'
                 '---------------\n'
                 '\n'
                 'This position is for an enthusiastic passionate candidate '
                 'who wants to become Product Development Engineer (PDE) in '
                 'Intel Manufacturing and Product Engineering (MPE). The '
                 'successful candidate is expected to participate in global '
                 'teams to enable Intel product roadmap.\n'
                 '\n'
                 'Responsibilities for this position include the following :\n'
                 '\n'
                 '* Perform evaluation and debug of new test program\n'
                 '* Resolve product manufacturability issues related to '
                 'product testing hardware and software\n'
                 '* Perform data analysis and deploy solutions to improve test '
                 'coverage, yield, capacity and product health indicators.\n'
                 '* The job also involves develop and debug of support '
                 'software for test program validation, data analysis and '
                 'debug.\n'
                 '\n'
                 'Qualifications\n'
                 '--------------\n'
                 '\n'
                 '* The successful candidate will be a Bachelor / Master '
                 'Graduate in Electrical Engineering, Electronic Engineering, '
                 'Telecommunication, Automation and Control Engineering, '
                 'Computer Engineering, or Computer Science.\n'
                 '* Excellent problem solving, technical, team and '
                 'communication skills.\n'
                 '* PERL and object oriented programming skill would be an '
                 'advantage for this position.\n'
                 '* Must possess 1st class honours degree or a min of 3.6 '
                 'CPGA\n'
                 '\n'
                 'Inside this Business Group\n'
                 '--------------------------\n'
                 '\n'
                 'In the Design Engineering Group (DEG), we take pride in '
                 'developing the best-in-class SOCs, Cores, and IPs that power '
                 'Intel’s products. From development, to integration, '
                 'validation, and manufacturing readiness, our mission is to '
                 'deliver leadership products through the pursuit of Moore’s '
                 'Law and groundbreaking innovations.\xa0 DEG is Intel’s '
                 'engineering group, supplying silicon to business units as '
                 'well as other engineering teams.\xa0 As a critical provider '
                 'of all Intel products, DEG leadership has a responsibility '
                 'to ensure the delivery of these products in a cost efficient '
                 'and effective manner.Posting Statement\n'

                 'engraving, polishing, painting, plating, and other material '
                 'processing operations.\n'

                 'and/or relevant previous job and/or internship experiences.\n'

                 'solutions. Verify the circuit behavior against the original '
                 'simulation model and first silicon. - Define VLSI Structural '
                 'Design methodology and developing design flows. Implement '
                 'structural physical designs, such as synthesis, floor '
                 'planning, power-grid and clock tree designs, timing '
                 'budgeting and closure, place and route, RC-extraction and '
                 'integration. Verify structural physical designs, such as '
                 'functional equivalency, timing/performance, noise, layout '
                 'design rules, reliability and power.- Develop Analog IP on '
                 "next generation deep submicron process for the Intel's SOC, "
                 'perform tasks related to Very-large-scale integration VLSI '
                 'complementary metal-oxide-semiconductor CMOS IC design, '
                 'Solid state physics and physical layout. Such tasks may '
                 'include: Circuit design of high speed clocking related '
                 'circuits [phase-locked loop PLL, delay-locked loop DLL, '
                 'bandgap] or high voltage input/output IO [double data rate '
                 'DDR/LPDDR, General-purpose input/output GPIO, OPIO].- '

                 'functional and/or timing convergence, and pre and post-si '

  'description': 'Job Description\n'
                 '---------------\n'
                 '\n'
                 'Come intern with one of the largest engineering companies in '
                 'the world. Join us to develop new technology that will '
                 'provide Intel a competitive advantage in programmable '
                 'solutions. If you find it exciting to work in a diverse team '
                 'that innovates with other Intel advanced technology groups, '
                 'with other industry leaders and academia, then we have your '
                 'opportunity. The Intel Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) '
                 'has been delivering industry-leading custom logic solutions '
                 "to customers since inventing the world's first "
                 'reprogrammable logic device in 1984. To expand the '
                 'technology that provides us with advantages in programmable '
                 'solutions, we are looking for a phenomenal intern to join '
                 'our high-powered team. Your responsibility involves working '
                 'closely with various Design teams, programmable logic memory '
                 'digital IP analog, and highspeed SERDES from the initial IP '
                 'product planning phase through design implementation and '
                 'verification. You will also be defining test methodologies, '
                 'developing test benches amp running simulations, deploying '
                 'test patterns, and validating them on silicon. Your work '
                 'also supports product teams with yield improvement and '
                 'highspeed SERDES, and memory interface characterization.\n'
                 '\n'
                 'The ideal candidate should exhibit the following behavioral '
                 'traits:\n'

                 '---------------\n'
                 '\n'
                 'If you are a "hands on" person and you like the rush and '

                 'next generation of technologies that will shape the future '
                 'for decades to come. You will be in a fast paced and '

                 '\n'

                 'school year, up to 40 hours a week on breaks/summers) with '
                 "flexible hours around a student's school schedule while "
                 'still in alignment with a one of the following factory '

                 '7PM\n'

                 '7AM\n'

                 'not be limited to:\n'

 {'_id': 'Intel49603743632',
  'company': 'Intel',
  'description': 'Job Description\n'
                 '---------------\n'
                 '\n'
                 'Join Intel and build a better tomorrow.  \n'
                 'Intel is in the midst of an exciting transformation, with a '
                 'vision to create and extend computing technology to connect '
                 'and enrich the lives of every person on Earth. So join us '
                 'and help us create the next generation of technologies that '
                 'will shape the future for decades to come.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '  \n'
                 'Corporate Services CS provides Intel employees the '
                 'infrastructure and environment to create breakthrough '
                 'technology that make amazing experiences possible. Our scope '
                 'is vast, whether we are providing services that help '
                 'employees stay productive and satisfied, or transforming how '
                 'we work by providing ultra pure water/chemicals and other '
                 'utilities to the factory process tools, shuttling employees '
                 'between sites, protecting the environment, keeping employees '
                 'safe, or building and maintaining offices, labs, and '
                 'factories. Our employees create a better tomorrow for all '
                 'Intel employees around the world.  \n'
                 'Position description\n'
                 '\n'
                 '  \n'
                 'In this position you will work as part of the CS Fab '
                 'Facilities and Operations team in the Site Projects Group. '
                 'As a graduate you will join a team of Engineers and Project '
                 'Managers gaining practical on-site experience working in a '
                 'wide variety of specialized process, mechanical and '
                 'electrical systems in a live manufacturing facility. SPG '
                 'work across the entire site including manufacturing and '
                 'front of house buildings. In this position you will work '
                 'with multiple stakeholders and M and E contractors, '
                 'Architectural contractors and Design firms.  \n'
                 'Roles and Responsibilities:\n'
                 '\n'
                 '* Support SPG project managers managing a wide spectrum of '
                 'Construction projects to enable Intel businesses including '
                 'new front of house conversions, facility system upgrades, '
                 'emergency break fix repairs and energy projects.\n'
                 '* Manage day to day construction operations to ensure '
                 'project safety is maintained\n'
                 '* Translate business and technical requirements into high '
                 'quality designs that enable biddable, affordable and '
                 'constructible solutions.\n'
                 '* Foster innovation and transform traditional construction '
                 'practices by driving new methods and engineering solutions '
                 "by leveraging industry insights to Intel's multidimensional "
                 'challenges\n'

                 'identify trends/outliers to reduce program/schedule/Quality '

                 'team/organization which will improve the construction '
                 'performance of the area.\n'

                 'required stakeholders to drive/implement change.\n'

  'description': 'Job Description\n'
                 '---------------\n'
                 '\n'
                 'In this position, you will be involving in the training, '
                 'design and development of next generation SOC/CPU for wide '
                 'range of Intel products. Your responsibilities will include '
                 'some of the following but not limited to:\n'
                 '- Assist design unit owner in Register Transfer Level RTL '
                 'model functional validation. Use CAD tool extensively to '
                 'simulate logic behavior and circuit performance and '
                 'direction of physical design for next generation, deep '
                 'sub-micron embedded circuit solutions. Verify the circuit '
                 'behavior against the original simulation model and first '
                 'silicon.\n'
                 ' - Define VLSI Structural Design methodology and developing '
                 'design flows. Implement structural physical designs, such as '
                 'synthesis, floor planning, power-grid and clock tree '
                 'designs, timing budgeting and closure, place and route, '
                 'RC-extraction and integration. Verify structural physical '
                 'designs, such as functional equivalency, timing/performance, '
                 'noise, layout design rules, reliability and power.\n'
                 '- Develop Analog IP on next generation deep submicron '
                 "process for the Intel's SOC, perform tasks related to "
                 'Very-large-scale integration VLSI complementary '
                 'metal-oxide-semiconductor CMOS IC design, Solid state '
                 'physics and physical layout. Such tasks may include: Circuit '
                 'design of high speed clocking related circuits [phase-locked '
                 'loop PLL, delay-locked loop DLL, bandgap] or high voltage '
                 'input/output IO [double data rate DDR/LPDDR, General-purpose '
                 'input/output GPIO, OPIO].\n'
                 '- Responsible for Integration of Third party IPs -- '
                 'Synthesis, functional and/or timing convergence, and pre and '
                 'post-si debug of IPs developed by various external vendors '
                 'as well as within the company. Handling of signals crossing '
                 'power planes and clock domains, industry standard protocols '
                 'including hardware and software details dealing with Memory '
                 'LPDDR, storage eMMC, SATA, UFS, peripherals PCIe, USB, and '
                 'MIPI interfaces in SOC devices. System integration dealing '
                 'with Si/ Platform/ FW/ MW/ drivers/ OS/ Apps on Android '
                 'Windows-based tablets and phones.Qualifications\n'

                 'platforms. This internship will focus on adversarial machine '
                 'learning research, specifically for deep learning. In this '
                 'position, you will join the Intel project team working on '
                 "DARPA's Guaranteeing AI Robustness Against Deception (GARD) "
                 'program to develop security solutions for machine learning '
                 'systems.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '  \n'

 {'_id': 'Intel48607377440',
  'company': 'Intel',
  'description': 'Job Description\n'
                 '---------------\n'
                 '\n'
                 'Intel PSG offers a large selection of intellectual property '
                 'IP cores optimized for Intel FPGA devices, all of which are '
                 'developed for highest performance, lowest cost, ease of use '
                 'and fastest time to market.The Custom IP Engineering '
                 'Solution group is responsible for High Speed Protocol IP '
                 'development, which includes participating in high-level '
                 'product specifications, logic(RTL) design and '
                 'implementation, RTL verification, IP FPGA emulation '
                 'prototyping and hardware validation using Quartus '
                 'Development Kit.As an IP Design Engineer focusing on IP '
                 'Verification and Validation, you will be responsible for '
                 'carrying out design validation for Intel next generation IP '
                 'across the Intel FPGA IP product portfolios. The charter of '
                 'IP verification and validation team is to verify and '
                 'validate the IP for robust functionality from functional '
                 'simulation, FPGA emulation prototyping, hardware to complex '
                 'system level environment. The verification and validation '
                 'areas encompass IP for external memory interface protocols '
                 'eg. DDR, HBM and high-speed transceiver protocols eg. PCIe, '
                 'Ethernet, Interlaken, JESD204, UPI, Serial Lite, Serial '
                 'Rapid IO. Your specific responsibilities and career '
                 'experience may include but are not limited to the '
                 'following:a. Create comprehensive verification and '
                 'validation plan based on FPGA IP architecture specifications '
                 'and carry out all the IP validation tasks. The plan '
                 'encompasses functional, system level and hardware '
                 'verification and validation perspectives.b. Developing IP, '
                 'subsystem or system level testbench, create tests, and '
                 'necessary coverage goals based on specification to verify '
                 'the implementation.c. Review verification and validation '
                 'results against the coverage goals. Writing, analyzing and '
                 'achieving coverage metrics with failures debugging as well '
                 'as bug filling and closure.d. Work with cross functional '
                 'teams, prepare and support IP functional validation tests '
                 'for IP bring-up on actual FPGA development kits using '
                 'Quartus.e. Build IP FPGA emulation prototypes, creating and '
                 'establishing IP subsystem (solution) validation coverage '
                 'strategy and standardized framework, drive system test '
                 'design implementation and overall IP system validation on '
                 'HW, maximize FPGA hardware capability to bring substantial '
                 'improvement to IP quality and usability for Intel FPGA IP '
                 'product portfolios.f. Developing verification and validation '
                 'tools and flows, as needed.g. Interfacing with 3rd party '
                 'vendors for latest industry tool and methodology or VIP '
                 'exposure and evaluation.h. Participate in IP roadmap '
                 'planning with product marketing as well as support interface '
                 'to IP customer support team.i. Apply advanced techniques to '
                 'achieve verification and validation with the highest '
                 'quality, productivity, and time to market.j. Provide '
                 'practical, innovative solutions to complex problems.k. '
                 'Participating in technical paper writing and '
                 'publication.Qualifications\n'
                 '--------------\n'
                 '\n'
                 'Skills and qualification of our Custom IP Verification and '
                 'Validation Engineer are as follow:\n'
                 'a. Bachelor degree in Electrical, Electronics, Computer '
                 'Engineering or equivalent.\n'
                 'b. Experience in FPGA, custom IC or ASIC design and '
                 'verification, demonstrated excellence in any of the product '
                 'development areas from architecture, design, validation to '
                 'product.\n'
                 'c. Experienced using advanced system design and validation '
                 'methodologies and technologies such as FPGA prototyping, '
                 'emulation, simulation and co emulation.\n'
                 'd. Experienced using advanced verification methodologies '
                 'such as UVM, OVM, VMM, System Verilog, constrained random '
                 'verification, assertion based verification, and functional '
                 'coverage techniques is a strong plus.\n'
                 'e. Experienced creating and executing validation plans.\n'
                 'f. Experience of leading a verification or validation team '
                 'is a strong plus.\n'
                 'g. Familiarity or experience in RTL design with Verilog and '
                 'VHDL is a strong plus.\n'
                 'h. Familiarity or experience in embedded SW and HW design is '
                 'a strong plus.\n'
                 'i. Knowledge of any memory interface protocol such as PCIe, '
                 'Ethernet, IEEE 1588, JESD204, Interlaken, Serial Lite or '
                 'Serial Rapid IO is a strong plus.\n'
                 'j. Familiarity with Perl, TCL and shell scripts is a plus.\n'
                 'k. Familiarity with Intel Quartus or Xilinx Vivado is a '
                 'plus.\n'
                 'l. Highly motivated to learn and adapt to fast changing '
                 'technologies and environments.\n'
                 'm. Exceptional analytical, problem solving and communication '
                 'skills, initiative, promote innovation and teamwork.\n'
                 'n. Self motivated and ability to excel in a team '
                 'environment.\n'
                 'o. Demonstrates fundamental values such as accountability, '
                 'integrity and a winning mindset.Inside this Business Group\n'

                 'market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a '
                 'wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. '
                 "Combining Altera's industry-leading FPGA technology and "
                 "customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor "
                 'manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create '
                 'the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched '

 {'_id': 'Intel47421978016',
  'company': 'Intel',
  'description': 'Job Description\n'
                 '---------------\n'
                 '\n'
                 'We are looking for product development engineers who are '
                 'looking to gain experience in timing and power models '
                 'validation, developing failure analysis / fault isolation '
                 '(FA/FI) solutions and driving process improvements towards '
                 'functional yield enhancement for the latest FPGA products. '
                 'In this position, you have the opportunity to work on: \n'
                 '- validation methodology and plans for post-silicon '
                 'validation of timing models\n'
                 '- FPGA validation pattern sets including driving capability '
                 'on various tester platforms to enable volume '
                 'characterization\n'
                 '- development and validation of power models (static and '
                 'dynamic) for FPGA products\n'
                 '- characterization of thermal sensing diode and validate '
                 'thermal profile modelled in software\n'
                 '- binning, bin-split and yield strategy \n'
                 '- development of models to improve yield/binning '
                 'predictability\n'
                 '- establishing target / limit to control yield\n'
                 '- development / bring-up of binning circuits\n'
                 '- yield optimization through process improvements in product '
                 'performance and power\n'
                 '- engaging worldwide teams on yield optimization across '
                 'cross-functional areas such as manufacturing setup, test '
                 'program, and wafer fabrication process '
                 'targeting/tuning.Qualifications\n'

 {'_id': 'Intel47276119280',
  'company': 'Intel',
  'description': 'Job Description\n'
                 '---------------\n'
                 '\n'
                 'In this position, you will be involving in the training, '
                 'design and development of next generation SOC/CPU for wide '
                 'range of Intel products. Your responsibilities will include '
                 'some of the following but not limited to:\n'
                 '- Assist design unit owner in Register Transfer Level RTL '
                 'model functional validation. Use CAD tool extensively to '
                 'simulate logic behavior and circuit performance and '
                 'direction of physical design for next generation, deep '
                 'sub-micron embedded circuit solutions. Verify the circuit '
                 'behavior against the original simulation model and first '
                 'silicon.\n'
                 ' - Define VLSI Structural Design methodology and developing '
                 'design flows. Implement structural physical designs, such as '
                 'synthesis, floor planning, power-grid and clock tree '
                 'designs, timing budgeting and closure, place and route, '
                 'RC-extraction and integration. Verify structural physical '
                 'designs, such as functional equivalency, timing/performance, '
                 'noise, layout design rules, reliability and power.\n'
                 '- Develop Analog IP on next generation deep submicron '
                 "process for the Intel's SOC, perform tasks related to "
                 'Very-large-scale integration VLSI complementary '
                 'metal-oxide-semiconductor CMOS IC design, Solid state '
                 'physics and physical layout. Such tasks may include: Circuit '
                 'design of high speed clocking related circuits [phase-locked '
                 'loop PLL, delay-locked loop DLL, bandgap] or high voltage '
                 'input/output IO [double data rate DDR/LPDDR, General-purpose '
                 'input/output GPIO, OPIO].\n'
                 '- Responsible for Integration of Third party IPs -- '
                 'Synthesis, functional and/or timing convergence, and pre and '
                 'post-si debug of IPs developed by various external vendors '
                 'as well as within the company. Handling of signals crossing '
                 'power planes and clock domains, industry standard protocols '
                 'including hardware and software details dealing with Memory '
                 'LPDDR, storage eMMC, SATA, UFS, peripherals PCIe, USB, and '
                 'MIPI interfaces in SOC devices. System integration dealing '
                 'with Si/ Platform/ FW/ MW/ drivers/ OS/ Apps on Android '
                 'Windows-based tablets and phones.Qualifications\n'
                 '--------------\n'
                 '\n'
                 'You must possess a Bachelor of Engineering degree or a '
                 'Master of Science degree in Electronic, Electrical or '
                 'Computer Engineering. Additional qualifications include: \n'
                 '- Familiarity with Very Large Scale Integration VLSI '
                 'Complementary Metal-Oxide Semiconductor CMOS logic circuit '
                 'design \n'
                 '- Well versed in UNIX, C programming and relevant Computer '
                 'Aided Design CAD tools.Inside this Business Group\n'
                 '--------------------------\n'
                 '\n'
                 'In the Design Engineering Group (DEG), we take pride in '
                 'developing the best-in-class SOCs, Cores, and IPs that power '
                 'Intel’s products. From development, to integration, '
                 'validation, and manufacturing readiness, our mission is to '
                 'deliver leadership products through the pursuit of Moore’s '
                 'Law and groundbreaking innovations.\xa0 DEG is Intel’s '
                 'engineering group, supplying silicon to business units as '
                 'well as other engineering teams.\xa0 As a critical provider '
                 'of all Intel products, DEG leadership has a responsibility '

                 'and effective manner.Other Locations\n'

 {'_id': 'Intel47276050672',
  'company': 'Intel',
  'description': 'Job Description\n'
                 '---------------\n'
                 '\n'
                 'In this position, you will be involving in the training, '
                 'design and development of next generation SOC/CPU for wide '
                 'range of Intel products. Your responsibilities will include '
                 'some of the following but not limited to:\n'
                 '- Assist design unit owner in Register Transfer Level RTL '
                 'model functional validation. Use CAD tool extensively to '
                 'simulate logic behavior and circuit performance and '
                 'direction of physical design for next generation, deep '
                 'sub-micron embedded circuit solutions. Verify the circuit '
                 'behavior against the original simulation model and first '
                 'silicon. \n'
                 '- Define VLSI Structural Design methodology and developing '
                 'design flows. Implement structural physical designs, such as '
                 'synthesis, floor planning, power-grid and clock tree '
                 'designs, timing budgeting and closure, place and route, '
                 'RC-extraction and integration. Verify structural physical '
                 'designs, such as functional equivalency, timing/performance, '
                 'noise, layout design rules, reliability and power.\n'
                 '- Develop Analog IP on next generation deep submicron '
                 "process for the Intel's SOC, perform tasks related to "
                 'Very-large-scale integration VLSI complementary '
                 'metal-oxide-semiconductor CMOS IC design, Solid state '
                 'physics and physical layout. Such tasks may include: Circuit '
                 'design of high speed clocking related circuits [phase-locked '
                 'loop PLL, delay-locked loop DLL, bandgap] or high voltage '
                 'input/output IO [double data rate DDR/LPDDR, General-purpose '
                 'input/output GPIO, OPIO].\n'
                 '- Responsible for Integration of Third party IPs -- '
                 'Synthesis, functional and/or timing convergence, and pre and '
                 'post-si debug of IPs developed by various external vendors '
                 'as well as within the company. Handling of signals crossing '
                 'power planes and clock domains, industry standard protocols '
                 'including hardware and software details dealing with Memory '
                 'LPDDR, storage eMMC, SATA, UFS, peripherals PCIe, USB, and '
                 'MIPI interfaces in SOC devices. System integration dealing '
                 'with Si/ Platform/ FW/ MW/ drivers/ OS/ Apps on Android '
                 'Windows-based tablets and phones.Qualifications\n'
                 '--------------\n'
                 '\n'
                 'You must possess a Bachelor of Engineering degree or a '
                 'Master of Science degree in Electronic, Electrical or '
                 'Computer Engineering. Additional qualifications include: - '
                 'Familiarity with Very Large Scale Integration VLSI '
                 'Complementary Metal-Oxide Semiconductor CMOS logic circuit '
                 'design - Well versed in UNIX, C programming and relevant '
                 'Computer Aided Design CAD tools.Inside this Business Group\n'
                 '--------------------------\n'
                 '\n'
                 'In the Design Engineering Group (DEG), we take pride in '
                 'developing the best-in-class SOCs, Cores, and IPs that power '
                 'Intel’s products. From development, to integration, '
                 'validation, and manufacturing readiness, our mission is to '
                 'deliver leadership products through the pursuit of Moore’s '
                 'Law and groundbreaking innovations.\xa0 DEG is Intel’s '
                 'engineering group, supplying silicon to business units as '
                 'well as other engineering teams.\xa0 As a critical provider '
                 'of all Intel products, DEG leadership has a responsibility '
                 'to ensure the delivery of these products in a cost efficient '
                 'and effective manner.Other Locations\n'
                 '---------------\n'
                 '\n'
                 'MY,PenangPosting Statement\n'
                 '-----------------\n'

  'description': 'Job Description\n'
                 '---------------\n'
                 '\n'
                 'In this position, you will be involving in the training, '
                 'design and development of next generation SOC/CPU for wide '
                 'range of Intel products and Internet of Things. Your '
                 'responsibilities will include one or some of the following '
                 'but not limited to:\n'
                 '-Assist design unit owner in Register Transfer Level RTL '
                 'model functional validation. Use CAD tool extensively to '
                 'simulate logic behavior and circuit performance and '
                 'direction of physical design for next generation, deep '
                 'sub-micron embedded circuit solutions. Verify the circuit '
                 'behavior against the original simulation model and first '
                 'silicon.\n'
                 '-Define VLSI Structural Design methodology and developing '
                 'design flows. Implement structural physical designs, such as '
                 'synthesis, floor planning, power-grid and clock tree '
                 'designs, timing budgeting and closure, place and route, '
                 'RC-extraction and integration. Verify structural physical '
                 'designs, such as functional equivalency, timing/performance, '
                 'noise, layout design rules, reliability and power.\n'
                 '-Develop Analog IP on next generation deep submicron process '
                 "for the Intel's SOC, perform tasks related to "
                 'Very-large-scale integration VLSI complementary '
                 'metal-oxide-semiconductor CMOS IC design, Solid state '
                 'physics and physical layout. Such tasks may include: Circuit '
                 'design of high speed clocking related circuits [phase-locked '
                 'loop PLL, delay-locked loop DLL, bandgap] or high voltage '
                 'input/output IO [double data rate DDR/LPDDR, General-purpose '
                 'input/output GPIO, OPIO].\n'
                 '-Responsible for Integration of Third party IPs -- '
                 'Synthesis, functional and/or timing convergence, and pre and '
                 'post-si debug of IPs developed by various external vendors '
                 'as well as within the company. Handling of signals crossing '
                 'power planes and clock domains, industry standard protocols '
                 'including hardware and software details dealing with Memory '
                 'LPDDR, storage eMMC, SATA, UFS, peripherals PCIe, USB, and '
                 'MIPI interfaces in SOC devices. System integration dealing '
                 'with Si/ Platform/ FW/ MW/ drivers/ OS/ Apps on Android and '
                 'Windows-based tablets and phones.\n'
                 '-Responsible to validate and integrate third party IPs '
                 'ensuring they meet product specification and functionality '
                 'before they are productized into physical chip. Required to '
                 'work very closely with design teams and architects to '
                 'implement the low-level RTL design to ensure overall good '
                 'functionality of the chip. Develop specific test '
                 'environment/platform, validation methodology and test plan '
                 'to validate SOC design by identifying and exercising '
                 'boundary conditions and special cases in an effort to break '
                 'the chip to find that last elusive bug.\n'
                 '-Oversees definition, design, verification, and '
                 'documentation for SoC System on a Chip development. '
                 'Determines architecture design, logic design, and system '
                 'simulation. Defines module interfaces/formats for '
                 'simulation. Performs Logic design for integration of cell '
                 'libraries, functional units and sub-systems into SoC full '
                 'chip designs, Register Transfer Level coding, and simulation '
                 'for SoCs. Contributes to the development of multidimensional '
                 'designs involving the layout of complex integrated circuits. '
                 'Performs all aspects of the SoC design flow from high-level '
                 'design to synthesis, place and route, timing and power to '
                 'create a design database that is ready for manufacturing. '
                 'Analyzes equipment to establish operation infrastructure, '
                 'conducts experimental tests, and evaluates results. May also '
                 'review vendor capability to support '
                 'development.Qualifications\n'
                 '--------------\n'
                 '\n'
                 'You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be '
                 'initially considered for this position:-Students pursuing a '
                 'Bachelor degree in EECS or related major with good CGPA-Good '
                 'communication skills and proficient in English-Knowledge on '
                 'Unix, VLSI Design, SOC/PC Architecture, System Verilog is '
                 'major plusInside this Business Group\n'
                 '--------------------------\n'
                 '\n'
                 'In the Design Engineering Group (DEG), we take pride in '
                 'developing the best-in-class SOCs, Cores, and IPs that power '
                 'Intel’s products. From development, to integration, '
                 'validation, and manufacturing readiness, our mission is to '
                 'deliver leadership products through the pursuit of Moore’s '
                 'Law and groundbreaking innovations.\xa0 DEG is Intel’s '
                 'engineering group, supplying silicon to business units as '
                 'well as other engineering teams.\xa0 As a critical provider '
                 'of all Intel products, DEG leadership has a responsibility '
                 'to ensure the delivery of these products in a cost efficient '

 {'_id': 'Intel47034880128',
  'company': 'Intel',
  'description': 'Job Description\n'
                 '---------------\n'
                 '\n'
                 'To support IC Design activities for Subsystem '
                 'designQualifications\n'
                 '--------------\n'
                 '\n'
                 'EE or related Degree\n'
                 'Good understanding of IC design flow and methodology\n'
                 '\n'
                 'Preferred Qualifications:\n'
                 'IC Design experience or hands-on using Cadence or '
                 'SynopsysInside this Business Group\n'
                 '--------------------------\n'
                 '\n'
                 'The Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the '
                 'acquisition of Altera. As part of Intel, PSG will create '
                 'market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a '
                 'wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. '
                 "Combining Altera's industry-leading FPGA technology and "
                 "customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor "
                 'manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create '
                 'the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched '
                 'performance and power efficiency. PSG takes pride in '
                 'creating an energetic and dynamic work environment that is '
                 'driven by ingenuity and innovation. We believe the growth '

  'company': 'Intel',
  'description': 'Job Description\n'
                 '---------------\n'
                 '\n'
                 'In this position, you will be involving in the training, '
                 'design and development of next generation SOC/CPU for wide '
                 'range of Intel products and Internet of Things. Your '
                 'responsibilities will include one or some of the following '
                 'but not limited to:\n'
                 '-Assist design unit owner in Register Transfer Level RTL '
                 'model functional validation. Use CAD tool extensively to '
                 'simulate logic behavior and circuit performance and '
                 'direction of physical design for next generation, deep '
                 'sub-micron embedded circuit solutions. Verify the circuit '
                 'behavior against the original simulation model and first '
                 'silicon.\n'
                 '-Define VLSI Structural Design methodology and developing '
                 'design flows. Implement structural physical designs, such as '
                 'synthesis, floor planning, power-grid and clock tree '
                 'designs, timing budgeting and closure, place and route, '
                 'RC-extraction and integration. Verify structural physical '
                 'designs, such as functional equivalency, timing/performance, '
                 'noise, layout design rules, reliability and power.\n'
                 '-Develop Analog IP on next generation deep submicron process '
                 "for the Intel's SOC, perform tasks related to "
                 'Very-large-scale integration VLSI complementary '
                 'metal-oxide-semiconductor CMOS IC design, Solid state '
                 'physics and physical layout. Such tasks may include: Circuit '
                 'design of high speed clocking related circuits [phase-locked '
                 'loop PLL, delay-locked loop DLL, bandgap] or high voltage '
                 'input/output IO [double data rate DDR/LPDDR, General-purpose '
                 'input/output GPIO, OPIO].\n'
                 '-Responsible for Integration of Third party IPs -- '
                 'Synthesis, functional and/or timing convergence, and pre and '
                 'post-si debug of IPs developed by various external vendors '
                 'as well as within the company. Handling of signals crossing '
                 'power planes and clock domains, industry standard protocols '
                 'including hardware and software details dealing with Memory '
                 'LPDDR, storage eMMC, SATA, UFS, peripherals PCIe, USB, and '
                 'MIPI interfaces in SOC devices. System integration dealing '
                 'with Si/ Platform/ FW/ MW/ drivers/ OS/ Apps on Android and '
                 'Windows-based tablets and phones.\n'
                 '-Responsible to validate and integrate third party IPs '
                 'ensuring they meet product specification and functionality '
                 'before they are productized into physical chip. Required to '
                 'work very closely with design teams and architects to '
                 'implement the low-level RTL design to ensure overall good '
                 'functionality of the chip. Develop specific test '
                 'environment/platform, validation methodology and test plan '
                 'to validate SOC design by identifying and exercising '
                 'boundary conditions and special cases in an effort to break '
                 'the chip to find that last elusive bug.\n'
                 '-Oversees definition, design, verification, and '
                 'documentation for SoC System on a Chip development. '
                 'Determines architecture design, logic design, and system '
                 'simulation. Defines module interfaces/formats for '
                 'simulation. Performs Logic design for integration of cell '
                 'libraries, functional units and sub-systems into SoC full '
                 'chip designs, Register Transfer Level coding, and simulation '
                 'for SoCs. Contributes to the development of multidimensional '
                 'designs involving the layout of complex integrated circuits. '
                 'Performs all aspects of the SoC design flow from high-level '
                 'design to synthesis, place and route, timing and power to '
                 'create a design database that is ready for manufacturing. '
                 'Analyzes equipment to establish operation infrastructure, '
                 'conducts experimental tests, and evaluates results. May also '
                 'review vendor capability to support '
                 'development.Qualifications\n'
                 '--------------\n'
                 '\n'

                 'initially considered for this position:-Students pursuing a '
                 'Bachelor degree in EECS or related major with good CGPA-Good '
                 'communication skills and proficient in English-Knowledge on '
                 'Unix, VLSI Design, SOC/PC Architecture, System Verilog is '
                 'major plusInside this Business Group\n'
                 '--------------------------\n'
                 '\n'

                 'developing the best-in-class SOCs, Cores, and IPs that power '
                 'Intel’s products. From development, to integration, '
                 'validation, and manufacturing readiness, our mission is to '
                 'deliver leadership products through the pursuit of Moore’s '

                 'validation of testability circuits.\n'
                 '* Evaluation, development and debug of complex test methods. '
                 'Develops and debugs complex software programs to convert '
                 'design validation vectors and drive complex test equipment.\n'
                 '* Creates and tests validation and production test hardware '
                 'solutions. Tests, validates, modifies and redesigns circuits '
                 'to guarantee component margin to specification.\n'
                 '* Analyzes and evaluates component specification versus '
                 'performance to ensure optimal match of component '
                 'requirements with production equipment capability with '
                 'specific emphasis on yield analysis and bin split '
                 'capability.\n'
                 '* Analyzes early customer returns with emphasis on driving '
                 'test hole closure activities.\n'
                 '* Creates and applies concepts for optimizing component '
                 'production relative to both quality and cost constraints.\n'

                 'judgment.\n'

 {'_id': 'Intel46943879312',
  'company': 'Intel',
  'description': 'Job Description\n'
                 '---------------\n'
                 '\n'
                 '**Join Intel and build a better tomorrow!**  \n'
                 'We create world-changing technology that improves the life '
                 'of every person on the planet every day in ways that you '
                 'probably don’t even see.\n'
                 '\n'
                 'We have big ambitions, and a passion to work with others and '
                 'address world challenges no one can tackle alone. We would '
                 'you love you to be part of this!\n'
                 '\n'
                 '**About the recruitment process**\n'
                 '\n'
                 'We will be considering your application based on your '
                 'resume. Once your application is submitted, you can check '
                 'the status of your application by accessing your candidate '
                 'profile. The recruiter will review your CV and offer it to '
                 'the team manager. Regardless of our decision you will '
                 'receive feedback from us.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '**About the internship**\n'
                 '\n'
                 'Join a team of researchers at Intel Labs in Europe '
                 'responsible for developing next generation edge and wireless '
                 'networking solutions.\n'
                 '\n'
                 'The role will include the exploration and development of '
                 'technologies to support orchestration, that cut across '
                 'monitoring or observability, workload profiling, modelling '
                 'and analytics targeting various usage models, from '
                 'performance optimizations to energy optimizations, etc.\n'
                 '\n'
                 'This researcher should have an interest in computing, '
                 'including deployment, testing, integration, and validation '
                 'of edge and cloud computing stacks. Responsibilities will '
                 'include design and development of extensions to cloud '
                 'stacks, instrumentation and monitoring as well as analytics '
                 'framework, with particular emphasis towards awareness of '
                 'underlying hardware features across Compute/Memory/Network.\n'
                 '\n'
                 'The researcher will work in close collaboration with leading '
                 'EU academic and industry partners as part of EU-wide '
                 'research projects.\n'
                 '\n'
                 'Research background on wireless communications and '
                 'networking, and system-level performance evaluation is '
                 'required. Hands on SW prototyping using Linux environment, '
                 'and systems simulation is required. Experience in working '
                 'across multiple teams and customers in complex collaborative '
                 'projects is highly desired.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '**We ask that all applicants are current university students '
                 'and will remain students during the whole internship. '
                 'Candidates must be based in Germany upon the start date of '
                 'this internship, and for its entire duration. We are unable '
                 'to support remote working from outside Germany.**\n'
                 '\n'
                 'Qualifications\n'
                 '--------------\n'
                 '\n'
                 '**We welcome applications from candidates with:**\n'
                 '\n'
                 '- PhD in EE/CS  \n'
                 '- Systems and scripting programming languages (e.g. Go, '
                 'Python, bash)  \n'
                 '- Virtualization and containerization (e.g. Kubernetes, '
                 'Containers, Services meshes like Istio, Linkerd)  \n'
                 '- Operating systems knowledge (Linux, Unix)  \n'
                 '- Software engineering skills (e.g. test driven development, '
                 'Agile methodologies, build and integration automation)  \n'
                 '- Skills in bringing theoretical ideas to proof of concept '
                 'and implementations  \n'
                 '  \n'
                 '**It would be an advantage if you had interest/knowledge and '
                 'would like to develop your skills in:**  \n'
                 '- Cloud Environments in particular Kubernetes, and its '
                 'constituent modules.  \n'
                 '- Data Science and Machine Learning  \n'
                 '- Knowledge of Software Defined Networking or Network '
                 'Function Virtualisation\n'
                 '\n'

                 '\n'

                 'equally brilliant colleagues will push you to be your best.\n'

                 '* Being a part of a socially and ecologically responsible '
                 'company ([read more about it '
                 'here](https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/corporate-responsibility/2030-goals.html)).\n'

                 'company to make your transition into work easier and a '
                 'personal buddy to help you build your network, answer any '

                 'assignment programs.\n'

 {'_id': 'Intel48239522592',
  'company': 'Intel',
  'description': 'Job Description\n'
                 '---------------\n'
                 '\n'
                 'Components Research delivers an innovative semiconductor and '
                 'packaging manufacturing technologies research pipeline for '
                 "Moore's law progression, new product opportunities, and "
                 'industry-leading process development. The group focuses on '
                 "unique, enabling capabilities across all aspects of Intel's "
                 'semiconductor processing and packaging roadmap. Components '
                 'Research engineers are responsible for leading programs to '
                 'design, fabricate and analyze novel devices, interconnects, '
                 'patterning, materials, systems, and integration schemes '
                 'across a wide variety of novel applications.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '  \n'
                 'The Components Research (CR) team is looking for a '
                 'passionate intern to join our team as an research engineer '
                 'intern supporting 3D test vehicle design, test, process '
                 'modeling and development.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '  \n'
                 'The ideal candidate should exhibit the following behavioral '
                 'traits:\n'
                 '\n'
                 '* Highly motivated individual willing to work within '
                 'schedule constraints and deliver high quality results on '
                 'time.\n'
                 '* Problem-solving and analytical skills.\n'
                 '* Effective prioritization and time management skills.\n'
                 '* Stakeholder management, strong collaboration, tolerance '
                 'for ambiguity, and critical thinking.\n'
                 '* Teamwork ethics.\n'
                 '* Willing to work in an agile work environment with a '
                 'fast-paced task flow.\n'
                 '* Interpersonal skills.\n'
                 '\n'
                 'Length of internship: Minimum of 3 months for summer 2023 '
                 'with the possibility to extend it as per business needs.\n'
                 '\n'
                 'Qualifications\n'
                 '--------------\n'
                 '\n'
                 'You must possess minimum qualifications to be initially '
                 'considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are '
                 'in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a '
                 'plus factor in identifying top candidates. Experience listed '
                 'below would be obtained through a combination of your school '
                 'work/classes/research and/or relevant previous job and/or '
                 'internship experiences. This is an entry level position and '
                 'will be compensated accordingly.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '**Minimum Qualifications:**\n'
                 '\n'
                 'The candidate must be pursuing a Ph.D. degree in Electrical '
                 'Engineering, Computer Engineering, Electronics Engineering, '
                 'Computer Architecture and Design, Mechanical Engineering, '
                 'Applied Physics, Physics, or Chemical Engineering.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '3+ months research experience in one or more of the '
                 'following areas:\n'
                 '\n'
                 '* Digital circuit analysis and design, chemical or physical '
                 'vapor deposition (CVD or PVD), chemical and mechanical '
                 'polishing, chemical or plasma etching processes, electronic '
                 'design automation, multiphysics modeling of electronic '
                 'materials or systems.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '**Preferred Qualifications:**\n'
                 '\n'
                 '* Experience in employing electronic device characterization '
                 'hardware for low voltage DC electrical measurements, as well '
                 'as willingness to work in a lab environment performing '
                 'hands-on measurements.\n'
                 '* Scientific and engineering programming experience and '
                 'proficiency in relevant scientific software libraries in at '
                 'least one language of choice\n'
                 '* Electronic digital circuit design experience for printed '
                 'circuit boards, electronic packages, or silicon design, with '
                 'experience using commercial or open-source design or layout '
                 'software.\n'

                 'software such as COMSOL for simulation of multi-physics '
                 'phenomena\n'
                 '* Have a proven track record of role-modeling safety in a '
                 'lab environment.\n'

                 'include but are not limited to:** \n'

                 'maintain facilities systems that support New Mexico CS '
                 'facilities.\n'

                 'procedures. Use Maximo Maintenance planning software.\n'

                 'within generally defined parameters.\n'

                 'Factories to operate optimally.\n'

                 'you graduate.\n'

                 'them to attend interviews in Intel’s offices for various '
